title: Handwashing Stations

requirements.question: Are handwashing stations available and accessible to all personnel who handle product?
requirements.automaticFailureReason: Handwashing stations must be available and accessible to all personnel who handle product to prevent contamination.

requirements.question: Are handwashing stations equipped with potable running water?
Are handwashing stations supplied with soap or suitable hand cleanser?
Are handwashing stations equipped with single-use towels or air dryers?
Are handwashing stations located in close proximity to toilet facilities?
Are handwashing stations clearly marked with signage?
Are handwashing stations maintained in a clean and sanitary condition?
Are waste receptacles provided at handwashing stations?
Is there documentation of regular inspection and maintenance of handwashing stations?

mandatoryStatements: All handwashing stations must be equipped with potable running water, soap or suitable hand cleanser, and single-use towels or air dryers.
Handwashing stations must be located in close proximity to toilet facilities and easily accessible to all personnel who handle product.
Regular inspection and maintenance of handwashing stations must be documented to ensure continuous availability and functionality.
Proper signage must be displayed at all handwashing stations to remind workers of handwashing requirements.
Waste receptacles must be provided and maintained at all handwashing stations to prevent contamination.
capaInject: Implement a daily inspection checklist for handwashing stations to ensure all supplies (soap, towels, water) are adequately stocked.
Establish a preventive maintenance schedule for handwashing station equipment including water supply systems and dispensers.
Install clear multilingual signage at all handwashing stations with proper handwashing technique instructions.
Assign responsibility for monitoring and restocking handwashing station supplies throughout the day.
Conduct periodic audits of handwashing station locations to ensure they meet accessibility requirements.
traceabilityInject: Maintain logs of handwashing station inspections including date, time, inspector name, and condition assessment.
Document any maintenance or repairs performed on handwashing stations including parts replaced and service dates.
Keep records of supply inventory levels and restocking activities for handwashing stations.
Track the location and identification number of each handwashing station in the operation.
Record any deficiencies found during inspections and corrective actions taken with completion dates.
micro_inject: Ensure handwashing stations are strategically located to minimize the risk of cross-contamination from toilet facilities to product handling areas.
Verify that handwashing procedures effectively reduce pathogenic bacteria on workers' hands through regular microbiological testing.
Monitor water quality at handwashing stations to ensure it meets potable water standards and does not introduce microbial contamination.
Implement protocols for immediate cleaning and sanitization of handwashing stations if contamination is suspected.
Ensure waste receptacles at handwashing stations are designed and maintained to prevent microbial growth and contamination.
